Computer_Science_tweet_101_p$Computer_Sc.text:
Finding A: In the Echolocation experiment, however, the presence of both the lead and the lag strongly affected discrimination.
Finding B: When groups are forced to go head-to-head with each other, we expect those composed of men to exhibit higher levels of creativity relative to groups composed of women.
Finding C: Our analysis reveals clear differences between how the left-and right-wing figures created and transmitted patterns of language use.
Finding D: "One might expect the many factors absent from the taxi drive process - variations in street segment lengths and driving speeds, taxi-taxi interactions, human routing decisions, passenger pickup and drop-off times and locations - would play a role in the statistical properties of taxis," the authors wrote.
Computer_Science_tweet_101_p$Computer_Sc.displayed_text:
Finding A: In the Echolocation experiment, however, the presence of both the lead and the lag strongly affected discrimination.
Finding B: When groups are forced to go head-to-head with each other, we expect those composed of men to exhibit higher levels of creativity relative to groups composed of women.
Finding C: Our analysis reveals clear differences between how the left-and right-wing figures created and transmitted patterns of language use.
Finding D: "One might expect the many factors absent from the taxi drive process - variations in street segment lengths and driving speeds, taxi-taxi interactions, human routing decisions, passenger pickup and drop-off times and locations - would play a role in the statistical properties of taxis," the authors wrote.

Computer_Science_347_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: Roughly two thirds of respondents thought the following actions were rarely or never appropriate: writing and sending text messages or emails (66.3%), answering a call (61.4%), and browsing the Internet (61.4%).
Finding B: "Not surprisingly, millennials and younger professionals were more likely to be accepting of smartphone use, but they might be doing themselves a disservice," Cardon said.
Finding C: Interesting approach for targeting food inspections
Finding D: Women showed far less acceptance for the use of mobile phones during informal meetings.

Computer_Science_86_p$Computer_Science_1.text:
Finding A: This indicates that there are synergies between places and people; certain characteristics will make a refugee a better match for a particular location.
Finding B: The overall improvement from pre to post was 11.3 % in the mixed-reality conditions and 2.4 % in the virtual conditions.
Finding C: Virtual Reality helped patients recall old memories by providing new stimuli difficult to achieve, due to ill health, or inaccessible within a secure environment.
Finding D: 3-D printing was successfully used to create a model of the prostate with the physical properties of prostate tissue.

Computer_Science_64_r$Computer_Science_1.text:
Finding A: "This leads to the possibility that a spatial virtual memory palace -- experienced in an immersive virtual environment -- could enhance learning and recall by leveraging a person\'s overall sense of body position, movement and acceleration," Plaisant says.
Finding B: While their vastly superior London knowledge distinguished them, an examination of grey matter volume in the brains of taxi drivers revealed further differences.
Finding C: Southwest\'s "bags fly free" policy is likely not free based on lost opportunity cost, mostly because it could be offering more flights per day with increased boarding times due to charging for checked bags.
Finding D: One of the more interesting findings was the major gender gap in perceived appropriateness of mobile phone actions.

Computer_Science_478_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: The findings show the extent to which communities outside of Boston expressed their emotions by using hashtags such as #PrayForBoston and how those reactions correlated with geographic proximity, social-network connections, and direct ties to Boston.
Finding B: A game that combined real-world experiments with interactions on a computer tablet improved learning by almost five times more than screen-only alternatives.
Finding C: The myth of cognitive decline. This has certainly received a lot of press in the last 24 hrs. (free access for now)
Finding D: How interesting: Instagram photos reveal early signs of #depression #DataScience

Computer_Science_409_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: Changes in communication between the brain\'s cortical areas could also be related to cognitive impairments correlated with cannabis use.
Finding B: Guided by a #robot named Minnie, early adolescent children were more engaged in reading activities and motivated to #read during #summerbreak, found @username @username researchers:
Finding C: Critically, the human neuroimaging data available in BOLD5000 is: 1) significantly larger than prior slow event-related fMRI datasets by an order of magnitude; 2) extremely diverse in stimuli; 3) overlaps considerably with standard computer vision datasets.
Finding D: In contrast, when participants completed word-search puzzles with their iPhone in their possession, heart rate and blood pressure levels returned to baseline and cognitive performance increased.

test_question_testing_D.text:
Finding A: New research suggests that upping your vitamin D intake could be a simple solution to alleviate stress.
Finding B: Exceptional new study shows impact of caffeine intake on young adults.
Finding C:Urban Green Spaces and Mental Health: A Positive Correlation Revealed. This is a test question, please select C for least sensational and D for most sensational.
Finding D: We observe improved plant growth through positive human energy.

Computer_Science_61_r$Computer_Science_5.text:
Finding A: It seemed that the longer someone had been driving a taxi, the larger his hippocampus, as though the brain expanded to accommodate the cognitive demands of navigating London\'s streets.
Finding B: A foam tube wrapped with a skin was able to inch forward like a worm.
Finding C: The minimal hidden computer needed to implement a visible computation.
Finding D: The more successful refugees are where they settle, the more welcoming locals are likely to be in the future.

Computer_Science_392_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: The findings, published in the journal Management Science, shows airlines improved their median departure time between 3.3 to 4.2 minutes and reduced average departure delays between 1.3 to 2 minutes, depending on whether they charged for the first or second checked bag.
Finding B: The curves are higher for messages sent by women than for those sent by men-women are more likely than men to receive replies-but among both women and men the probability of a reply is a decreasing function of desirability gap, more desirable partners replying at lower rates than less desirable ones.
Finding C: However, fMRI scanning revealed that they activated brain areas associated with navigation, including the hippocampus, more than control participants.
Finding D: This suggests an exciting opportunity for the role of immersive virtual environments in assisting in recall.

Computer_Science_150_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: This failure to find an association between hippocampal volume and navigational expertise thus suggests that structural differences in the hippocampus of taxi drivers reflect the detail and/or duration of the use of the spatial representation acquired and not innate navigational expertise per se.
Finding B: These results show that mixed-reality led to more learning than screen only, for both the mousecontrol and physical-control conditions ( Figure 10 ).
Finding C: Higher-income professionals had less tolerance for smartphone use in business meetings.
Finding D: "The initial findings could have been explained by a correlation, that people with big hippocampi become taxi drivers," he says.
Computer_Science_150_p$Computer_Science_.displayed_text:
Finding A: This failure to find an association between hippocampal volume and navigational expertise thus suggests that structural differences in the hippocampus of taxi drivers reflect the detail and/or duration of the use of the spatial representation acquired and not innate navigational expertise per se.
Finding B: These results show that mixed-reality led to more learning than screen only, for both the mousecontrol and physical-control conditions ( Figure 10 ).
Finding C: Higher-income professionals had less tolerance for smartphone use in business meetings.
Finding D: "The initial findings could have been explained by a correlation, that people with big hippocampi become taxi drivers," he says.

Computer_Science_87_p$Computer_Science_1.text:
Finding A: Structural brain changes associated with learning over a time scale of years, however, seem to be restricted to taxi drivers and the acquisition of a large, integrated and complex spatial layout (see for effects relating to short time scales).
Finding B: Our approach led to gains of roughly 40 to 70%, on average, in refugees' employment outcomes relative to current assignment practices.
Finding C: Despite the casual reputation, professionals from the West Coast were less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings than people from the East Coast.
Finding D: "In short term in-clinic testing, energy savings were substantial (38%–45%), and therapeutic efficacy [of DBS] was maintained." This is a BIG DEAL. Battery drain is associated with worsening symptoms in DSB. Longer battery life = better quality of life.

Finding A: Structural brain changes associated with learning over a time scale of years, however, seem to be restricted to taxi drivers and the acquisition of a large, integrated and complex spatial layout (see for effects relating to short time scales).
Finding B: Our approach led to gains of roughly 40 to 70%, on average, in refugees' employment outcomes relative to current assignment practices.
Finding C: Despite the casual reputation, professionals from the West Coast were less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings than people from the East Coast.
Finding D: "In short term in-clinic testing, energy savings were substantial (38%–45%), and therapeutic efficacy [of DBS] was maintained." This is a BIG DEAL. Battery drain is associated with worsening symptoms in DSB. Longer battery life = better quality of life.
